programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: In this episode we follow three stories of sons coming to terms with the past. (Final)

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: Take a trip back to 1982 when Michael Parkinson spoke with Elton John.

Tens of thousands of passports and licences have gone missing in the post, prompting fraud fears. South Australia is struggling to cope with the algal bloom. Plus Sarah Ferguson interviews author Arundhati Roy.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: These days, thousands of Australians are swapping four walls for four wheels and taking to life on the road. Myf Warhurst hits the bitumen in Far North Queensland to meet some of the people whove chosen van life.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.sub-title: Is Putin a master manipulator or a very smart guy?
programme.desc: US Peace Envoy Steve Witkoff has met with Vladimir Putin to try and negotiate a ceasefire. We dont know what happened in those meetings, and it appears that Witkoff didnt know what was happening in those meetings either.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: DNA evidence linked to the health secretarys assassination forces Nikki to face her past in the present. As her investigation progresses, Nikki realises that its consequences will affect her, and her profession, forever.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Nakari Thorpe, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Myf Warhurst continues her van life odyssey in northern New South Wales and Western Australia. Setting out to discover when van life became a thing, she wonders if there comes a time when this nomadic life loses its appeal?

programme.title: The Family Next Door
programme.desc: As tensions in the court rise, the truth of Isabelles investigation is finally revealed.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: The incredible true story of a man left on the front seat of a car in Northern Ireland and a woman abandoned six years later in a telephone box in the Republic of Ireland.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa meets the clivia king, Hannah visits a shady garden defying the odds, Sophie profiles flowers of the protea family, Clarence visits a First Nations owned and run nursery, and Millie gets started with winter jobs.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: Ahead of the Pacific Islands Forum, we look at how Beijing got its way over who could attend. Plus how a landmark ICJ ruling could eventually see small island nations take legal action against big emitters like Australia.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ruby Cornish brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: With one concert spot remaining, our everyday pianists are playing for the shoppers in the heart of Sydneys China Town.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Nakari Thorpe, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: Professor T befriends a vulnerable girl and is convinced she is the key witness to a murder. Dan and Lisa agree to go on a date. Her boss confronts her about their inappropriate relationship, Lisa makes a bold decision.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Detective Pikachu Returns and Spawn Squad!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we investigate how many rubber chickens Detective Pikachu Returns deserves, plus Mollie and Reggie from Gardening Australia Junior join the Spawn Squad, and Granny Gem gives some sage advice!

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: When MacArthur has a bad fall in the school, the kids recollections of the event are just as weird as they are.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Unable to declare her love to Adrien, Marinette turns to Cat Noir to help her rehearse. But their closeness is not to everyones liking, starting with Glaciator.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Turtle Thief
programme.desc: When a turtle is stolen from Ryans back yard, Ezra offers the agencys services but Maudie is convinced something about the robbery doesnt add up.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.sub-title: Bitzer Puts His Foot In It
programme.desc: The Farmer is laying concrete and Bitzer is left to guard it while it dries. But the wet cement proves too much of a temptation for Shaun and the flock...

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal how amazing your saliva is, and they find out why the hospitals maintenance teamwork with birds of prey. Dr Chris heads to the Emergency Department to find how the doctors know who to treat first.

programme.title: Teenage Boss: Next Level
programme.desc: All singing, all dancing Mal wants to take her mum to see their favourite musical but her savings goal gets all out of step!

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Cities: Skylines Ii and Sonic Superstars!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP; we review the epic city building of Cities: Skylines II, speedrun our way through a Sonic Superstars review, and some special guests from Turn Up The Volume join the Spawn Squad!

programme.title: rage Stockholm Syndrome Special
programme.desc: From ABBA to Viagra Boys, The Cardigans, Robyn and more, rage lines up the best tracks from bands and artists who hail from the Nordic lands of Sweden.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears think they have what it takes to make and star in a viral video, but when Nom Nom decides that they dont, Grizz breaks into the koalas limo to change his mind.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Adriens bodyguard gets akumatized into Gorizilla. Endowed with extraordinary strength and an acute sense of smell, he tracks Adrien all through Paris. Ladybug and Cat Noir cant monkey around if they want to stop him!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Misplaced Mug
programme.desc: Mr McGillick is upset after he loses his precious Worlds Best Principal mug so Ezra makes it his personal mission to get it back.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Grab a Pickaxe, its Minecraft Mania!
programme.desc: Gem celebrates all things Minecraft with special guests the Fairbairn Brothers! Plus, theres a Creeper in The New Coach, a nasty surprise in Finding Player 2, and options for when youve mastered Minecraft Survival!

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This penultimate episode will determine which of our incredible fighting machines makes it into the grand final, along with the final two robots to compete in our Ten Robot Rumble.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: In this show we see a battle to jump into underpants, and another to wrap chips, meanwhile a contortionist battles her nerves.

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.sub-title: Gentle and Soft: The Story Of The Blue Jean Committee, Part 1
programme.desc: A special documentary charting the rise and fall of softrocks seminal band, the Blue Jean Committee.

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: An abandoned cabin isnt quite what it seems for Bea and Louis, while Meg and Glen discover a new quality to the alien rock in the ground.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug and Cat Noir face Aurore Boreale again, now Stormy Weather 2. Our superheroes will have to keep their cool if they want to stop her!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Triple Inbestigation
programme.desc: While on the hunt for Ezras missing goldfish, Maudie uncovers two more puzzling mysteries to be solved.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: In a flashback, Charlie has an adventure in the Mexican desert.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: O accidentally pops Is incredibly important dot. Can his friends fix it? This episode has fun with the short O sound and the words pop, cod, dot, cop, pot, pod and dot.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: With everything from mid-battle diarrhoea to a warlord taking over a Geography class, join us on a journey charting the rise and fall of some of Historys biggest Empires.

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House New Home
programme.desc: George visits a coach house in Leamington Spa that has been hacked about over the years to make it habitable plus, George takes a trip to Mellor to visit a 200-year-old farm house on the edge of the Peak District.

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House New Home
programme.desc: George visits Jawad and Charlie who are dead set on creating a magnificent master en-suite in their Victorian villa in Leeds, and in Brixton, Jason and Hannah are tackling an ambitious two storey extension.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Fighting for Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug in this episode are Steely Dan devotee Liam, Boogie Boarding enthusiast Paul, Skyrim video game fan Steph, and Noel Fielding admirer Lucy!

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: President Trump escalates his war on cartels and threatens sending in the troops to Chicago, but is any of it legal? Plus the key moments from RFK Jrs trainwreck Senate hearing and the push for him to resign.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Decorating was never going to be a simple task in the Harper household, particularly when Ben discovers that Janeys boyfriend, Stupid Brian, has been recruited by Susan to help.

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: The funniest routines by renowned and up-and-coming comedians - bringing them to life in sketch form - featuring Russell Kane, Travis Jay, Chloe Petts, Olga Koch, Michael Stranney, Sikisa and Seann Walsh.

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: Having recruited Beas help, things dont go to plan for Dragonfly when Glen attempts to teleport himself through the energy source.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Tomoe Tsurugi (Kagami Tsurugis mother) gets akumatized into Ikari Gozen. Armed with her bokken, she wants to punish Kagami for disobeying her by locking her up forever in the giant armour that forms around her body.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Missing Solar System
programme.desc: Pixie is horrified when her space diorama goes missing and Miss Tan falsely accuses her of not doing her homework.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: The Howlington kids enlist the help of Scarlet and her Granny to infiltrate the wolfhunter headquarters and retrieve the Doom Rock.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: P, E and N take on a pesky pen, who can draw anything it wants to escape them. This episode introduces the letter E and the words pen, peg and pet.

programme.title: Lets Sing!
programme.desc: Join Tim Minchin and The Sydney Childrens Choir and sing along to Tims song, When I Grow Up.

programme.title: Learn Mandarin
programme.desc: Join Harper as she learns about where in the world Chinese dialects are spoken and some basic greetings before she sets off on her trip to China.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Emma and Lee Fozard are in desperate need of Phils property expertise. A couple with three young boys, Emma and Lee have outgrown their current home. But is it good enough to put on the market in its current state?

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House New Home
programme.desc: Retired couple Charles and Ian Stringer are finally getting round to a complete redesign of their Edwardian home. Plus George tackles an 1850s country house which has had some very bizarre additions over the years.

programme.title: Game Night
programme.desc: Maxs brother arranges a murder mystery party for Game Night, with fake thugs and federal agents. With no rules, no points, and no idea who all the players are, this might be the most fun theyve ever had... or not.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines are eating their Pontipine dinner, when Mr Pontipines moustache flies off! First it gets stuck on the chimney, then the bridge and then the gazebo.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector creates a performance of sight and sound for his friends.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is teaching Charlie throwing! Charlie interrupts Bings explanation about how the fruit was knocked over, and so Flop thinks Charlie did it. Now Bing must tell Flop the truth.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig loves to watch television but Peppa Pig thinks that he needs to do some exercise as his tummy is looking a bit big. Peppa gives him LOTS of exercises to do. Daddy Pig is exhausted by the end of the day.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Judy loses a tooth quite literally- Will it be found in time for bed and will the tooth fairy like marmalade?

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: The Wolfies want to master the PJ Riders, so they steal them to assert their dominance.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly are having fun playing together in the meadow. Holly gets frustrated when Ben uses his elf skills to win all the games. Then Ben gets frustrated when Holly uses her magic skills to win all the games.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At Peppas playgroup Madame Gazelle takes the class through a simple tots workout using hoops that you spin around your waist.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A celebrity quokka visits Kangaroo Beach to film an episode of the smash hit TV series Wallaby Waters.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Lobo and Glorb sneak away at the amusement park, but when Glorb gets stuck on the Ferris Wheel, they learn that rules arent to ruin fun - theyre to keep them safe.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Huge, knitted sculptures are appearing all around town. A giant cupcake on Hatties cafe, oversized knitted fruit and vegetables on top of Joses shop and a massive cardigan on the school.

programme.title: Mini Kids
programme.desc: The toddlers are visited by a duck. Fantus helps a little monkey find its parent.

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.sub-title: No Wrong Way To Be You
programme.desc: Its Hair Do Day on Sesame Street and Jonathan Van Ness is coming to do everyones hair.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Z likes a good snooze, filling the air with floaty zeds. This episode introduces the letters Y and Z and the words zap, yak, yap, yell, jazz and zigzag.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Mummy and Daddy go on a trip to the childrens festival where there is singing, making crafts and listening to stories. They stay overnight in a tent, though it looks like its going to rain.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger encounters an injured Mamma Pea-Rex who quickly befriends the baby Pea-Rexes. Ginger goes off to play alone and lands herself in trouble but is rescued by some unexpected friends.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Sunny has trouble falling asleep at the clinic, so Vida gathers all his comforts of home to help.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley and the children make a huge dinosaur model for the museum.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton becomes bad when hes changed by a mysterious asteroid.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A celebrity quokka visits Kangaroo Beach to film an episode of the smash hit TV series Wallaby Waters.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas has a run of bad luck, he tries everything to get back on track... even if it means following Lorenzos strange, superstitious advice!

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: Its the reefs annual swimming carnival and the Reefies are ready to cheer along their fast fishie friend, Dash. Together, they learn its not important whether you win or lose; its just about giving it a go.Â

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds discover some of the clever things that happen on railways! Two passenger trains become one in a faraway railway station, and then they see how freight trains move giant boxes all around the country!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want Dad all to themselves until they discover he has some gross habits.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa and Granny Pig have been growing strawberries to make jam but when they discover that the birds have eaten them all, they go to a strawberry farm.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Pirate bus Ted is hijacked by Captain Dot, and Mojo and Bo sail the streets to stop her.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: After a mudslide buries a hot spring snakes home, Tweak, Dashi, Tunip, and Paani use the brand new Terra-Gup 1 to navigate the harsh Himalayan conditions and find the snake a new hot spring home.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Judo wants to play in the dirt with Bluey and Bingo, but shes not supposed to get dirty!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee introduces the squirrels to Bucky his old rocking horse. Saddle up, squirrels!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea swaps Supertatos Tato-Belt with her evil Baddie-Belt which has absurd and baffling functions. Supertato has to work out how to rescue Carrot and Pea with the Baddie-Belt.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dad has to stop having fun with the girls and go to work, Bluey and Bingo scramble to keep him playing games with them on the trampoline!

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Make Up Your Mind Upsy Daisy
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy is singing in the garden when the ball bounces along and comes to a rest beside her. Upsy Daisy cant make up her mind whether to sing or play with the ball.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers starlings, and an amazing display of sound and movement.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing, Sula and Pando are SUPERHEROES in the park. Bing rescues Flop from the giant spider, but falls off the rope and Hoppity has an accident! Now they have to rescue Hoppity.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George have to tidy their bedroom. Once the room is tidy Mummy says they can go back to their game. The room doesnt stay tidy for long. Peppas doll and Georges dinosaur are at the bottom of the toy box.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington becomes a work bear and helps Mr. Brown in the home office but learns computers can be tricky things.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Newton feels unappreciated by his friends and decides to head off and explore solo but falls into the clutches of Gloop III.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle has a cold and needs medicine. Nanny Plum, Holly and Ben have fun collecting the ingredients for a magic potion to make him better, including a dewdrop from a spiders web, slug slime and the burp of a frog.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy, Daddy, Peppa and George go to the park where they meet their friends, swing on the monkey bars, bounce on a bouncy branch and end with lots of muddy puddles.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy and Gemma investigate the mysterious disappearance of several boats in Kangaroo Beachs Barramundi Triangle.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Cleo prepares her friends for the preschool potluck by teaching them manners in a game. Nervous but determined, the Super Monsters impress Cleos mom with their kindness and teamwork.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanleys friends throw a surprise birthday party for him. No working for Stan today. Cynthia and Jose spring into action when Amare calls and rush to help.

programme.title: Mini Kids
programme.desc: The toddlers are visited by a rat. Fantus helps a little toucan find its parent.

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Abby and Rudy join in on a game of pickleball. Rudy feels frustrated when hes the only one who struggles to get the ball over the net.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: B, O and X discover a box filled with everything they need to put on a performance of Sleeping Beauty. This episode has fun with lots of letters - and the words box, hag, red, ted and bed.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa and Granny Pig have been growing strawberries to make jam but when they discover that the birds have eaten them all, they go to a strawberry farm.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Gingers baby Broccolisaurus friend kicks their ball into Potatodon territory. Now they have challenge the Potatodons to a game to win it back.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Popcorn runs on his hamster wheel all night, hes cranky the next day. But will he nap?

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stan helps his friends to get a closer look at the moon through a telescope.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When Newton turns his back on his space powers, Luna exploits him to get back to the moon.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy and Gemma investigate the mysterious disappearance of several boats in Kangaroo Beachs Barramundi Triangle.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in the Super Stunt Rally.

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: When Oli the octopus wins a game of hide and seek, shes awarded a special prize; the chance to learn expert hiding skills from the reefs Master of Disguise.Â

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds meet a bee and follow it home to its hive! They watch bees collect nectar, make honey, protect the hive, and care for babies - all in their buzzing bee kingdom.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Judo wants to play in the dirt with Bluey and Bingo, but shes not supposed to get dirty!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and friends visit a Petting Farm where they enjoy feeding chickens and meeting cute and squeaky guinea pigs and they all learn its important to wash your hands after handling the little animals.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Mojo and Bo cant let Dot see her birthday present early, but Dot cant be stopped!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: An earthquake in Alaska causes tremors that travel all the way to the Nevada Desert, causing big trouble in a pool of water that a group of tiny pupfish call home.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers and Luckys family get together to watch the big game!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels meet a little worm who has swallowed a bit too much earth and has got the hiccups.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli decides to become a superhero called Super Chilli! His superhero skills are put to the test when Evil Pea covers Supertato in sticky honey, but Chillis heat saves the day.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On a trip to the Dump Dad claims hes the best at everything. But Bluey discovers that Dads throwing out her old drawing and questions if he really is the best Dad in the world.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: In rural China, a strict one-child policy saw many girls abandoned by their parents who only wanted boys. Many of these unwanted girls were given away to foster families who raised them to be future wives for their sons.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A special on the future of rural towns and cities - why are some regional populations growing while others are declining?
